title: Zero ring
summary: In ring theory, a branch of mathematics, the zero ring[1][2][3][4][5] or trivial ring is the unique ring (up to isomorphism) consisting of one element. (Less commonly, the term "zero ring" is used to refer to any rng of square zero, i.e., a rng in which xy = 0 for all x and y.  This article refers to the one-element ring.)
